verses.roman:
kṛṣṇe svadhāmopagate
dharma-jñānādibhiḥ saha
kalau naṣṭa-dṛśām eṣa
purāṇārko 'dhunoditaḥ

synonyms: kṛṣṇe—Lord Kṛṣṇa; sva-dhāma—to His personal abode; upagate—having returned; dharma-jñāna-ādibhiḥ saha—along with religious principles, transcendental knowledge, and so on; kalau—in this Age of Kali; naṣṭa-dṛśām—of persons who have lost their spiritual vision; eṣaḥ—this; purāṇa-arkaḥ—Purāṇa or Vedic literature that shines like the sun; adhunā—at the present moment; uditaḥ—has arisen.
translation: " 'After Lord Kṛṣṇa departed for His abode along with religious principles and transcendental knowledge, this Purāṇa, Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, has arisen like the sun in this Age of Kali to enlighten those who have no spiritual vision.'
